013package org.apache.juneau.serializer;
014
015import static java.util.stream.Collectors.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
018
019import java.util.*;
020import java.util.concurrent.*;
021import java.util.function.*;
022import java.util.stream.*;
023
024import org.apache.juneau.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
029
030/**
031 * Represents a group of {@link Serializer Serializers} that can be looked up by media type.
032 *
033 * <h5 class='topic'>Description</h5>
034 *
035 * Provides the following features:
036 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
037 *    <li>
038 *       Finds serializers based on HTTP <c>Accept</c> header values.
039 *    <li>
040 *       Sets common properties on all serializers in a single method call.
041 *    <li>
042 *       Clones existing groups and all serializers within the group in a single method call.
043 * </ul>
044 *
045 * <h5 class='topic'>Match ordering</h5>
046 *
047 * Serializers are matched against <c>Accept</c> strings in the order they exist in this group.
048 *
049 * <p>
050 * Adding new entries will cause the entries to be prepended to the group.
051 * This allows for previous serializers to be overridden through subsequent calls.
052 *
053 * <p>
054 * For example, calling <code>g.append(S1.<jk>class</jk>,S2.<jk>class</jk>).append(S3.<jk>class</jk>,S4.<jk>class</jk>)</code>
055 * will result in the order <c>S3, S4, S1, S2</c>.
056 *
057 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
058 * <p class='bjava'>
059 *    <jc>// Construct a new serializer group</jc>
060 *    SerializerSet <jv>serializers</jv> = SerializerSet.<jsm>create</jsm>();
061 *       .add(JsonSerializer.<jk>class</jk>, UrlEncodingSerializer.<jk>class</jk>) <jc>// Add some serializers to it</jc>
062 *       .forEach(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv>.swaps(TemporalCalendarSwap.IsoLocalDateTime.<jk>class</jk>))
063 *       .forEachWS(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv>.ws())
064 *       .build();
065 *
066 *    <jc>// Find the appropriate serializer by Accept type</jc>
067 *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = <jv>serializers</jv>
068 *       .getWriterSerializer(<js>"text/foo, text/json;q=0.8, text/*;q:0.6, *\/*;q=0.0"</js>);
069 *
070 *    <jc>// Serialize a bean to JSON text </jc>
071 *    AddressBook <jv>addressBook</jv> = <jk>new</jk> AddressBook();  <jc>// Bean to serialize.</jc>
072 *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jv>addressBook</jv>);
073 * </p>
074 *
075 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
076 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
077 * </ul>
078 *
079 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
080 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/SerializersAndParsers">Serializers and Parsers</a>
081
082 * </ul>
083 */
084public final class SerializerSet {
085
086   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
087   // Static
088   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
089
090   /**
091    * An identifier that the previous entries in this group should be inherited.
092    * <p>
093    * Used by {@link SerializerSet.Builder#set(Class...)}
094    */
095   @SuppressWarnings("javadoc")
096   public static abstract class Inherit extends Serializer {
097      public Inherit(Serializer.Builder builder) {
098         super(builder);
099      }
100   }
101
102   /**
103    * An identifier that the previous entries in this group should not be inherited.
104    * <p>
105    * Used by {@link SerializerSet.Builder#add(Class...)}
106    */
107   @SuppressWarnings("javadoc")
108   public static abstract class NoInherit extends Serializer {
109      public NoInherit(Serializer.Builder builder) {
110         super(builder);
111      }
112   }
113
114   /**
115    * Static creator.
116    *
117    * @param beanStore The bean store to use for creating beans.
118    * @return A new builder for this object.
119    */
120   public static Builder create(BeanStore beanStore) {
121      return new Builder(beanStore);
122   }
123
124   /**
125    * Static creator.
126    *
127    * @return A new builder for this object.
128    */
129   public static Builder create() {
130      return new Builder(BeanStore.INSTANCE);
131   }
132
133   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
134   // Builder
135   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
136
137   /**
138    * Builder class.
139    */
140   @FluentSetters
141   public static class Builder extends BeanBuilder<SerializerSet> {
142
143      List<Object> entries;
144      private BeanContext.Builder bcBuilder;
145
146      /**
147       * Create an empty serializer group builder.
148       *
149       * @param beanStore The bean store to use for creating beans.
150       */
151      protected Builder(BeanStore beanStore) {
152         super(SerializerSet.class, beanStore);
153         this.entries = list();
154      }
155
156      /**
157       * Clone an existing serializer group.
158       *
159       * @param copyFrom The serializer group that we're copying settings and serializers from.
160       */
161      protected Builder(SerializerSet copyFrom) {
162         super(copyFrom.getClass());
163         this.entries = list((Object[])copyFrom.entries);
164      }
165
166      /**
167       * Clone an existing serializer group builder.
168       *
169       * <p>
170       * Serializer builders will be cloned during this process.
171       *
172       * @param copyFrom The serializer group that we're copying settings and serializers from.
173       */
174      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
175         super(copyFrom);
176         bcBuilder = copyFrom.bcBuilder == null ? null : copyFrom.bcBuilder.copy();
177         entries = list();
178         copyFrom.entries.stream().map(this::copyBuilder).forEach(x -> entries.add(x));
179      }
180
181      private Object copyBuilder(Object o) {
182         if (o instanceof Serializer.Builder) {
183            Serializer.Builder x = (Serializer.Builder)o;
184            Serializer.Builder x2 = x.copy();
185            if (Utils.ne(x.getClass(), x2.getClass()))
186               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Copy method not implemented on class {0}", x.getClass().getName());
187            x = x2;
188            if (bcBuilder != null)
189               x.beanContext(bcBuilder);
190            return x;
191         }
192         return o;
193      }
194
195      @Override /* BeanBuilder */
196      protected SerializerSet buildDefault() {
197         return new SerializerSet(this);
198      }
199
200      /**
201       * Makes a copy of this builder.
202       *
203       * @return A new copy of this builder.
204       */
205      public Builder copy() {
206         return new Builder(this);
207      }
208
209      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
210      // Properties
211      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
212
213      /**
214       * Associates an existing bean context builder with all serializer builders in this group.
215       *
216       * @param value The bean contest builder to associate.
217       * @return This object.
218       */
219      public Builder beanContext(BeanContext.Builder value) {
220         bcBuilder = value;
221         forEach(x -> x.beanContext(value));
222         return this;
223      }
224
225      /**
226       * Applies an operation to the bean context builder.
227       *
228       * @param operation The operation to apply.
229       * @return This object.
230       */
231      public final Builder beanContext(Consumer<BeanContext.Builder> operation) {
232         if (bcBuilder != null)
233            operation.accept(bcBuilder);
234         return this;
235      }
236
237      /**
238       * Adds the specified serializers to this group.
239       *
240       * <p>
241       * Entries are added in-order to the beginning of the list in the group.
242       *
243       * <p>
244       * The {@link NoInherit} class can be used to clear out the existing list of serializers before adding the new entries.
245       *
246       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
247       * <p class='bjava'>
248       *    SerializerSet.Builder <jv>builder</jv> = SerializerSet.<jsm>create</jsm>();  <jc>// Create an empty builder.</jc>
249       *
250       *    <jv>builder</jv>.add(FooSerializer.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// Now contains:  [FooSerializer]</jc>
251       *
252       *    <jv>builder</jv>.add(BarSerializer.<jk>class</jk>, BazSerializer.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// Now contains:  [BarParser,BazSerializer,FooSerializer]</jc>
253       *
254       *    <jv>builder</jv>.add(NoInherit.<jk>class</jk>, QuxSerializer.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// Now contains:  [QuxSerializer]</jc>
255       * </p>
256       *
257       * @param values The serializers to add to this group.
258       * @return This object.
259       * @throws IllegalArgumentException If one or more values do not extend from {@link Serializer}.
260       */
261      public Builder add(Class<?>...values) {
262         List<Object> l = list();
263         for (Class<?> e : values) {
264            if (Serializer.class.isAssignableFrom(e)) {
265               l.add(createBuilder(e));
266            } else {
267               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid type passed to SerializeGroup.Builder.add(): {0}", e.getName());
268            }
269         }
270         entries.addAll(0, l);
271         return this;
272      }
273
274      /**
275       * Sets the specified serializers for this group.
276       *
277       * <p>
278       * Existing values are overwritten.
279       *
280       * <p>
281       * The {@link Inherit} class can be used to insert existing entries in this group into the position specified.
282       *
283       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
284       * <p class='bjava'>
285       *    SerializerSet.Builder <jv>builder</jv> = SerializerSet.<jsm>create</jsm>();  <jc>// Create an empty builder.</jc>
286       *
287       *    <jv>builder</jv>.set(FooSerializer.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// Now contains:  [FooSerializer]</jc>
288       *
289       *    <jv>builder</jv>.set(BarSerializer.<jk>class</jk>, BazSerializer.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// Now contains:  [BarParser,BazSerializer]</jc>
290       *
291       *    <jv>builder</jv>.set(Inherit.<jk>class</jk>, QuxSerializer.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// Now contains:  [BarParser,BazSerializer,QuxSerializer]</jc>
292       * </p>
293       *
294       * @param values The serializers to set in this group.
295       * @return This object.
296       * @throws IllegalArgumentException If one or more values do not extend from {@link Serializer} or named <js>"Inherit"</js>.
297       */
298      public Builder set(Class<?>...values) {
299         List<Object> l = list();
300         for (Class<?> e : values) {
301            if (e.getSimpleName().equals("Inherit")) {
302               l.addAll(entries);
303            } else if (Serializer.class.isAssignableFrom(e)) {
304               l.add(createBuilder(e));
305            } else {
306               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid type passed to SerializeGroup.Builder.set(): {0}", e.getName());
307            }
308         }
309         entries = l;
310         return this;
311      }
312
313      private Object createBuilder(Object o) {
314         if (o instanceof Class) {
315
316            // Check for no-arg constructor.
317            ConstructorInfo ci = ClassInfo.of((Class<?>)o).getPublicConstructor(ConstructorInfo::hasNoParams);
318            if (ci != null)
319               return ci.invoke();
320
321            // Check for builder create method.
322            @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
323            Serializer.Builder b = Serializer.createSerializerBuilder((Class<? extends Serializer>)o);
324            if (bcBuilder != null)
325               b.beanContext(bcBuilder);
326            o = b;
327         }
328         return o;
329      }
330
331      /**
332       * Registers the specified serializers with this group.
333       *
334       * <p>
335       * When passing in pre-instantiated serializers to this group, applying properties and transforms to the group
336       * do not affect them.
337       *
338       * @param s The serializers to append to this group.
339       * @return This object.
340       */
341      public Builder add(Serializer...s) {
342         prependAll(entries, (Object[])s);
343         return this;
344      }
345
346      /**
347       * Clears out any existing serializers in this group.
348       *
349       * @return This object.
350       */
351      public Builder clear() {
352         entries.clear();
353         return this;
354      }
355
356      /**
357       * Returns <jk>true</jk> if at least one of the specified annotations can be applied to at least one serializer builder in this group.
358       *
359       * @param work The work to check.
360       * @return <jk>true</jk> if at least one of the specified annotations can be applied to at least one serializer builder in this group.
361       */
362      public boolean canApply(AnnotationWorkList work) {
363         for (Object o : entries)
364            if (o instanceof Serializer.Builder)
365               if (((Serializer.Builder)o).canApply(work))
366                  return true;
367         return false;
368      }
369
370      /**
371       * Applies the specified annotations to all applicable serializer builders in this group.
372       *
373       * @param work The annotations to apply.
374       * @return This object.
375       */
376      public Builder apply(AnnotationWorkList work) {
377         return forEach(x -> x.apply(work));
378      }
379
380      /**
381       * Performs an action on all serializer builders in this group.
382       *
383       * @param action The action to perform.
384       * @return This object.
385       */
386      public Builder forEach(Consumer<Serializer.Builder> action) {
387         builders(Serializer.Builder.class).forEach(action);
388         return this;
389      }
390
391      /**
392       * Performs an action on all writer serializer builders in this group.
393       *
394       * @param action The action to perform.
395       * @return This object.
396       */
397      public Builder forEachWS(Consumer<WriterSerializer.Builder> action) {
398         return forEach(WriterSerializer.Builder.class, action);
399      }
400
401      /**
402       * Performs an action on all output stream serializer builders in this group.
403       *
404       * @param action The action to perform.
405       * @return This object.
406       */
407      public Builder forEachOSS(Consumer<OutputStreamSerializer.Builder> action) {
408         return forEach(OutputStreamSerializer.Builder.class, action);
409      }
410
411      /**
412       * Performs an action on all serializer builders of the specified type in this group.
413       *
414       * @param <T> The serializer builder type.
415       * @param type The serializer builder type.
416       * @param action The action to perform.
417       * @return This object.
418       */
419      public <T extends Serializer.Builder> Builder forEach(Class<T> type, Consumer<T> action) {
420         builders(type).forEach(action);
421         return this;
422      }
423
424      /**
425       * Returns direct access to the {@link Serializer} and {@link Serializer.Builder} objects in this builder.
426       *
427       * <p>
428       * Provided to allow for any extraneous modifications to the list not accomplishable via other methods on this builder such
429       * as re-ordering/adding/removing entries.
430       *
431       * <p>
432       * Note that it is up to the user to ensure that the list only contains {@link Serializer} and {@link Serializer.Builder} objects.
433       *
434       * @return The inner list of entries in this builder.
435       */
436      public List<Object> inner() {
437         return entries;
438      }
439
440      private <T extends Serializer.Builder> Stream<T> builders(Class<T> type) {
441         return entries.stream().filter(x -> type.isInstance(x)).map(x -> type.cast(x));
442      }
443
444      // <FluentSetters>
445
446      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanBuilder */
447      public Builder impl(Object value) {
448         super.impl(value);
449         return this;
450      }
451
452      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanBuilder */
453      public Builder type(Class<?> value) {
454         super.type(value);
455         return this;
456      }
457
458      // </FluentSetters>
459
460      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
461      // Other methods
462      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
463
464      @Override /* Object */
465      public String toString() {
466         return entries.stream().map(this::toString).collect(joining(",","[","]"));
467      }
468
469      private String toString(Object o) {
470         if (o == null)
471            return "null";
472         if (o instanceof Serializer.Builder)
473            return "builder:" + o.getClass().getName();
474         return "serializer:" + o.getClass().getName();
475      }
476   }
477
478   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
479   // Instance
480   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
481
482   // Maps Accept headers to matching serializers.
483   private final ConcurrentHashMap<String,SerializerMatch> cache = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
484
485   private final MediaRange[] mediaRanges;
486   private final List<MediaRange> mediaRangesList;
487   private final Serializer[] mediaTypeRangeSerializers;
488
489   private final MediaType[] mediaTypes;
490   private final List<MediaType> mediaTypesList;
491   final Serializer[] entries;
492   private final List<Serializer> entriesList;
493
494   /**
495    * Constructor.
496    *
497    * @param builder The builder for this bean.
498    */
499   protected SerializerSet(Builder builder) {
500
501      this.entries = builder.entries.stream().map(this::build).toArray(Serializer[]::new);
502      this.entriesList = u(alist(entries));
503
504      List<MediaRange> lmtr = list();
505      Set<MediaType> lmt = set();
506      List<Serializer> l = list();
507      for (Serializer e : entries) {
508         e.getMediaTypeRanges().forEachRange(x -> {
509            lmtr.add(x);
510            l.add(e);
511         });
512         e.forEachAcceptMediaType(x -> lmt.add(x));
513      }
514
515      this.mediaRanges = lmtr.toArray(new MediaRange[lmtr.size()]);
516      this.mediaRangesList = u(alist(mediaRanges));
517      this.mediaTypes = lmt.toArray(new MediaType[lmt.size()]);
518      this.mediaTypesList = u(alist(mediaTypes));
519      this.mediaTypeRangeSerializers = l.toArray(new Serializer[l.size()]);
520   }
521
522   private Serializer build(Object o) {
523      if (o instanceof Serializer)
524         return (Serializer)o;
525      return ((Serializer.Builder)o).build();
526   }
527
528   /**
529    * Creates a copy of this serializer group.
530    *
531    * @return A new copy of this serializer group.
532    */
533   public Builder copy() {
534      return new Builder(this);
535   }
536
537   /**
538    * Searches the group for a serializer that can handle the specified <c>Accept</c> value.
539    *
540    * <p>
541    * The <c>accept</c> value complies with the syntax described in RFC2616, Section 14.1, as described below:
542    * <p class='bcode'>
543    *    Accept         = "Accept" ":"
544    *                      #( media-range [ accept-params ] )
545    *
546    *    media-range    = ( "*\/*"
547    *                      | ( type "/" "*" )
548    *                      | ( type "/" subtype )
549    *                      ) *( ";" parameter )
550    *    accept-params  = ";" "q" "=" qvalue *( accept-extension )
551    *    accept-extension = ";" token [ "=" ( token | quoted-string ) ]
552    * </p>
553    *
554    * <p>
555    * The returned object includes both the serializer and media type that matched.
556    *
557    * @param acceptHeader The HTTP <l>Accept</l> header string.
558    * @return The serializer and media type that matched the accept header, or <jk>null</jk> if no match was made.
559    */
560   public SerializerMatch getSerializerMatch(String acceptHeader) {
561      if (acceptHeader == null)
562         return null;
563      SerializerMatch sm = cache.get(acceptHeader);
564      if (sm != null)
565         return sm;
566
567      MediaRanges a = MediaRanges.of(acceptHeader);
568      int match = a.match(mediaRangesList);
569      if (match >= 0) {
570         sm = new SerializerMatch(mediaRanges[match], mediaTypeRangeSerializers[match]);
571         cache.putIfAbsent(acceptHeader, sm);
572      }
573
574      return cache.get(acceptHeader);
575   }
576
577   /**
578    * Same as {@link #getSerializerMatch(String)} but matches using a {@link MediaType} instance.
579    *
580    * @param mediaType The HTTP media type.
581    * @return The serializer and media type that matched the media type, or <jk>null</jk> if no match was made.
582    */
583   public SerializerMatch getSerializerMatch(MediaType mediaType) {
584      return getSerializerMatch(mediaType.toString());
585   }
586
587   /**
588    * Same as {@link #getSerializerMatch(String)} but returns just the matched serializer.
589    *
590    * @param acceptHeader The HTTP <l>Accept</l> header string.
591    * @return The serializer that matched the accept header, or <jk>null</jk> if no match was made.
592    */
593   public Serializer getSerializer(String acceptHeader) {
594      SerializerMatch sm = getSerializerMatch(acceptHeader);
595      return sm == null ? null : sm.getSerializer();
596   }
597
598   /**
599    * Same as {@link #getSerializerMatch(MediaType)} but returns just the matched serializer.
600    *
601    * @param mediaType The HTTP media type.
602    * @return The serializer that matched the accept header, or <jk>null</jk> if no match was made.
603    */
604   public Serializer getSerializer(MediaType mediaType) {
605      if (mediaType == null)
606         return null;
607      return getSerializer(mediaType.toString());
608   }
609
610   /**
611    * Same as {@link #getSerializer(String)}, but casts it to a {@link WriterSerializer}.
612    *
613    * @param acceptHeader The HTTP <l>Accept</l> header string.
614    * @return The serializer that matched the accept header, or <jk>null</jk> if no match was made.
615    */
616   public WriterSerializer getWriterSerializer(String acceptHeader) {
617      return (WriterSerializer)getSerializer(acceptHeader);
618   }
619
620   /**
621    * Same as {@link #getSerializer(MediaType)}, but casts it to a {@link WriterSerializer}.
622    *
623    * @param mediaType The HTTP media type.
624    * @return The serializer that matched the accept header, or <jk>null</jk> if no match was made.
625    */
626   public WriterSerializer getWriterSerializer(MediaType mediaType) {
627      return (WriterSerializer)getSerializer(mediaType);
628   }
629
630   /**
631    * Same as {@link #getSerializer(String)}, but casts it to an {@link OutputStreamSerializer}.
632    *
633    * @param acceptHeader The HTTP <l>Accept</l> header string.
634    * @return The serializer that matched the accept header, or <jk>null</jk> if no match was made.
635    */
636   public OutputStreamSerializer getStreamSerializer(String acceptHeader) {
637      return (OutputStreamSerializer)getSerializer(acceptHeader);
638   }
639
640   /**
641    * Same as {@link #getSerializer(MediaType)}, but casts it to a {@link OutputStreamSerializer}.
642    *
643    * @param mediaType The HTTP media type.
644    * @return The serializer that matched the accept header, or <jk>null</jk> if no match was made.
645    */
646   public OutputStreamSerializer getStreamSerializer(MediaType mediaType) {
647      return (OutputStreamSerializer)getSerializer(mediaType);
648   }
649
650   /**
651    * Returns the media types that all serializers in this group can handle.
652    *
653    * <p>
654    * Entries are ordered in the same order as the serializers in the group.
655    *
656    * @return An unmodifiable list of media types.
657    */
658   public List<MediaType> getSupportedMediaTypes() {
659      return mediaTypesList;
660   }
661
662   /**
663    * Returns a copy of the serializers in this group.
664    *
665    * @return An unmodifiable list of serializers in this group.
666    */
667   public List<Serializer> getSerializers() {
668      return entriesList;
669   }
670
671   /**
672    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this group contains no serializers.
673    *
674    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this group contains no serializers.
675    */
676   public boolean isEmpty() {
677      return entries.length == 0;
678   }
679}
